item.description:
I didn't see this film at the PSIFF. But it got a standing ovation at the end in one of the showings. One of the few films shot in Inuit language. I'll be there around 7:10 pm or so hanging out in the Aetna Theatre lobby.


In 1952, an Inuit hunter with tuberculosis
is forced to leave his northern
home and family to recuperate
at a sanatorium in Quebec.
Uprooted from all that he knows,
he becomes despondent until he
meets a young Inuit orphan. Based
on fact. Audience favorite at the
2009 Palm Springs International
Film Festival.
item.how_to_find_us: I still look likemy picture, glasses, pony tail

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: The Necessities of Life
